projects.title: Japan Geospatial Times
projects.description: A blog site that disseminates information about Japan's GIS historical background, projects, and use cases to the international GIS community in English. The site itself is built with open source technology, and provides a mechanism for others to contribute to article writing in markdown format. It aims to become an information hub with domestic and international GIS communities, not just information dissemination.

projects.title: Kashiwa-Tanaka Map Log
projects.description: A map information site specialized for my residential area, created as part of civic activities (Japanese only). It provides web maps useful for daily life, such as nursery maps, disaster prevention maps, urban planning maps, and traffic accident occurrence maps, mainly utilizing open data. Through this, I practice creating a livable community through co-creation with local governments and civic organizations.

projects.title: World Earthquakes Map
projects.description: An application that feeds USGS earthquake data and displays it on a web map. Technically simple, but a site that continuously receives about 10,000 page views per month.

projects.title: ChronoGlobe
projects.description: A digital globe that displays the current time around the world, sunrise and sunset times, and the day-night boundary line. Created for testing MapLibre GL JS's GlobeView.
